# Construction General Permit (CGP) Guide (2026)

## What is the CGP?

The Construction General Permit regulates stormwater discharges from construction sites. Officially called the NPDES General Permit for Storm Water Discharges Associated with Construction and Land Disturbance Activities.

## Who Needs Coverage?

### Required Coverage
- Construction disturbing 1 acre or more
- Part of larger plan of development exceeding 1 acre
- Linear projects (roads, utilities) ≥ 1 acre

### Exemptions
- Disturbance < 1 acre (unless part of larger plan)
- Emergency construction
- Routine maintenance
- Agricultural operations

## Risk Levels

### Risk Level 1 (Low)
- Low erosion risk
- Low receiving water risk
- Basic requirements

### Risk Level 2 (Medium)
- Moderate erosion risk
- Or moderate receiving water risk
- Additional requirements

### Risk Level 3 (High)
- High erosion risk
- Or high receiving water risk
- Most stringent requirements
- Effluent monitoring required

## Enrollment Process

### Step 1: Develop SWPPP
- Stormwater Pollution Prevention Plan
- Site-specific
- Before construction begins

### Step 2: Register in SMARTS
- Stormwater Multiple Application & Report Tracking System
- [Annual Reporting Requirements](https://smarts.waterboards.ca.gov)
- Create account

### Step 3: Submit NOI
- Notice of Intent
- Upload SWPPP
- Pay fee

### Step 4: Receive WDID
- Waste Discharge Identification number
- Confirms coverage
- Post at site

## Fees (2025-26)

**Formula:** $511 + ($54 × acres disturbed)
**Maximum:** $11,311

| Project Size | Fee |
|--------------|-----|
| 1 acre | $565 |
| 5 acres | $781 |
| 10 acres | $1,051 |
| 50 acres | $3,211 |
| 200+ acres | $11,311 (max) |

## SWPPP Requirements

### Must Include:
- Site description and map
- Construction schedule
- Erosion and sediment controls
- Non-stormwater BMPs
- Post-construction BMPs
- Inspection schedule
- Training records

### Key BMPs
**Erosion Control:**
- Soil binders
- Mulching
- Hydroseeding

**Sediment Control:**
- Silt fences
- Fiber rolls
- Sediment basins
- Check dams

**Good Housekeeping:**
- Material storage
- Waste management
- Vehicle tracking control

## Inspections

### Self-Inspection Required
- Before predicted rain
- After rain events
- Weekly at minimum
- Document in SWPPP

### Records Retention
- Maintain for 3 years after NOT
- Make available for inspection

## Termination (NOT)

### When to File
- Final stabilization achieved
- All BMPs functioning
- Site handed off to long-term owner

### Final Stabilization
- 70% native vegetation cover, OR
- Equivalent permanent cover

## Resources

**SMARTS:** [Annual Reporting Requirements](https://smarts.waterboards.ca.gov)
**CGP Order:** [Construction Stormwater Program](https://www.waterboards.ca.gov/water_issues/programs/stormwater/construction.html)
**CASQA BMP Handbook:** [CASQA Resources](https://www.casqa.org)

## Take Action
1. Learn more at [Construction](https://www.waterboards.ca.gov/water_issues/programs/stormwater/construction.html).
2. Access the [Construction General Permit (CGP)](https://smarts.waterboards.ca.gov) to manage permits and reports.
3. Learn more at [Construction General Permit (CGP)](https://www.casqa.org).
